STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 31, 2024
Delora ONeill
WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES GAYLORD
1260 S OTSEGO AVE,
GAYLORD, MI, 49735-9587
Re: License #: CB690358779
SI #: 2024SIC0001353
Dear Delora ONeill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001353
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 17, 2024
License #: CB690358779
Licensee Group Organization: Wellspring Lutheran Services
Licensee Designee: DAVID M GEHM
Chief Administrator: Delora KYSER ONeill
Agency Name: WELLSPRING LUTHERAN SERVICES
GAYLORD
Agency Address: 1260 S OTSEGO AVE
GAYLORD, MI 49735-9587
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 01/15/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
4/17/2024 3:45 PM Email Special Investigation Initiation
5/2/2024 10:00 AM Phone Interview
5/6/2024 9:30 AM Email Documentation received or sent
5/9/2024 2:00 PM Phone Interview
5/9/2024 2:15 PM Phone Interview
5/14/2024 12:45 PM Phone Interview
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Special evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section • (6) An agency shall do all the following:
Description
• (b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that the foster
parent has a right to have his or her written response
included as an attachment to the report required by
subrule (5) of this rule.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster parent was not informed in writing by licensing staff that he
was able to provide a written response to special evaluation
findings.
Investigation Chief Administrator (CA) was contacted on April 17, 2024, and
was informed of the allegations. No further information was
provided.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May
2, 2024. She stated the agency notifies foster parents of their right
to provide a written response that would be included as an
attachment to the report per policy. The specific language is
included in every cover letter the agency sends with the special
evaluation reports.
Regarding Foster Parent, he was provided this cover letter and
notified of this right for each special evaluation. Agency sent the
cover letter to Foster Parent (FP) for the investigation dated
1/12/2022 on 4/13/2022. FP sent a response to the report on
10/29/2022. Upon receipt, the response was uploaded to the
system. Agency sent the cover letter to FP for the investigation
dated 3/30/2022 on 6/29/2022. FP provided emails as a response
on 9/11/2023. This was uploaded to the system.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 9, 2024.
There was no additional information reported.
Foster parent (FP) was interviewed via telephone on May 9,
2024. He acknowledged there have been 3 special investigations
conducted on his foster home license and he received copies of
all the reports, however he was not notified he had the right to file
2

a written response to each investigation. He stated the first special
investigation that occurred in 2019 he was provided a copy of the
report in person. The second special investigation in early 2022
was mailed to him and he also requested a copy be sent via
email. FP stated the third special investigation later in 2022 was
emailed to him. He stated he was only provided the report itself
and there was not a cover letter that accompanied it.
FP stated a friend who has experience in licensing informed him
he had the right to provide a written response to the special
investigations. Once he became aware he submitted a written
response.
Licensing Worker 1 was interviewed via telephone on May 14,
2024. She stated she is no longer employed with the agency but
during her time there she was briefly assigned to licensing. During
this time, she was assigned to one of the three special evaluations
involving FP. She stated she followed a checklist the agency used
to ensure completion of all special evaluation requirements and
Licensing Supervisor also followed up to make sure things were
completed. Licensing Worker 1 believes making sure a copy of the
special evaluation is sent to the foster parent along with informing
of their right to provide a written response is part of the checklist,
but she could not recall for certain.
Licensing Worker 2 was not able to be interviewed. A
telephone call was made to her on May 13, 2024, and the phone
number is no longer in service.
Documents Reviewed:
• SI # 2020C0628144: intake 10/29/2019, completed and
approved on 4/3/2020. Cover letter dated 4/4/2020. Cover
letter states FP may add a written response to the report.
Advises a written response can be submitted to Licensing
Worker 1 or Licensing Supervisor.
• SI # 2022C0630395: intake 1/12/2022, completed and
approved 4/12/2022. Cover letter dated 4/13/2022. Cover
letter states FP has the right to have a written response
included as an attachment to the report identified in the
letter. Asks that any written response be forwarded to
Licensing Supervisor.
• SI # 2022C0630703: intake 3/30/2022, completed and
approved 6/28/2022. Cover letter dated 6/29/2022 states a
copy of the report is being provided to FP. Cover letter
states FP has the right to have a written response included
as an attachment to the report identified in the letter. Asks
3

that any written response be forwarded to Licensing
Supervisor.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on review of foster
parent’s electronic foster home file there is a cover letter uploaded
for all three of the special investigations completed that states
foster parent has the right to provide a written response and have
it included as an attachment to the report.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code License recommendation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12325
Section • (6) An agency shall provide the department with all
Description documentation that details the basis for the agency's
recommendation or any requested documentation for a
department licensing action.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster Parent provided written responses to licensing staff at
some point, but those responses were not provided to DCWL
Disciplinary Action Unit and adversely affected the outcome of an
administrative hearing.
Investigation Chief Administrator (CA) was contacted on April 17, 2024, and
was informed of the allegations. No further information was
provided.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on May
2, 2024. She stated the agency did not provide Foster Parent’s
written responses from the special investigations to the
Disciplinary Action Unit (DAU). She stated the agency was not
asked to provide anything to DAU for the administrative hearing.
She clarified DAU staff involved had the hearing packets and
access to all the information in the foster parent’s file.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 9, 2024.
There was no additional information reported.
Foster parent (FP) was interviewed via telephone on May 9,
2024. He stated he participated in the administrative hearing
regarding his foster home license that started in October 2023 and
was completed in January 2024. Toward the end of the
administrative hearing the judge asked FP if he had responded to
the special investigations, and he stated that he had. DAU staff
4

informed Licensing Worker 1 was interviewed via telephone
on May 14, 2024. She stated she was aware of the DAU
administrative hearing, but she did not participate. She stated she
believes Licensing Supervisor handled all tasks related to the
hearing.
Licensing Worker 2 was not able to be interviewed. A
telephone call was made to her on May 13, 2024, and the phone
number is no longer in service.
the judge they had no record of FP’s written responses. He stated
he was then able to submit his written responses.
It was shortly after the conclusion of the January 2022 special
investigation that he became aware he had the right to provide a
written response. He stated he provided his written response via
email and received confirmation from the Licensing Supervisor
that she had received them and uploaded them.
Disciplinary Action Unit Supervisor (DAU supervisor) was
interviewed via video conference on May 10, 2024. She stated
written responses are something they like to see included in the
packet if those were provided to the agency. She stated there is a
DAU checklist and that document is completed by the Child
Placing Agency and outlines the documentation they are providing
to DAU. It is not a document that is completed by DAU requesting
specific information or documentation. Per the licensing rules, a
written response provided by a foster parent becomes an
attachment of the special investigation report and should be
provided together. DAU Supervisor stated typically an agency will
provide all relevant information and documentation or notify DAU
that something was provided and is uploaded in the foster home
file, however in this instance, the written responses from foster
parent were not provided and they were not informed until the end
of the administrative hearing. DAU supervisor stated the outcome
of the administrative hearing was not adversely affected by the
omittance of the written responses, however those should have
been provided along with the special investigation reports.
Documents Reviewed:
• SI # 2020C0628144: intake 10/29/2019, completed and
approved on 4/3/2020. FP provided a written response that
is electronically signed and dated 10/13/2022.
• SI # 2022C0630395: intake 1/12/2022, completed and
approved 4/12/2022. 10-page written response provided by
5

FP. (not dated). Social work contact dated 1/22/2022 states
FP emailed his written response to the allegations.
• SI # 2022C0630703: intake 3/30/2022, completed and
approved 6/28/2022. FP emailed his written response to
the agency.
• DAU checklist completed by agency: recommendation is
revocation. Current CWL-4005, Special Evaluation Report
box is checked indicating it is being provided to DAU. The
Foster Parent Correspondence/Written Response box is
not checked indicating it is not being provided to DAU.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance. Licensing Supervisor
expressed understanding that written responses are included as
an attachment of a special investigation. She acknowledged the
agency did receive written responses from Foster Parent on all 3
special investigations but did not provide them to DAU. In addition,
foster parent correspondence/written response is listed as an
option on the DAU checklist submitted by the agency, however
they did not check the box indicating they were being sent with the
revocation recommendation documents.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
_____5/14/2024___________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
05/31/2024

Area Manager
